intro: Virola cogolloi, commonly known as the yellow virola, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae and is characterized by its large, glossy leaves and fragrant, yellow flowers. The tree produces a heavy, aromatic resin that has been traditionally used by indigenous communities for medicinal and ritual purposes. Its bark and wood are also valued for their durability and unique scent. Virola cogolloi plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting a diverse array of flora and fauna.
